intro: Hieracium leucocybe, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish-green to white flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and a taproot system. Hieracium leucocybe is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in temperate regions.
